DataElement.preferredName: Lung Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for lung cancer based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to clinical N stage of a lung tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/13/17 tt transferred context; changed def - 1st letter upper case; changed Reg Status to Qualified. 12/16/11 - Unretired CTEP 11/20/11 Retired BCRv1.0 content as part of model cleanup task.  2010- Updated to use NCIt based Property

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lung Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system derives from analyses of the new retrospective and prospective databases of the International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer (IASLC). These databases contain information on patients diagnosed with lung cancer from 1999 to 2010 originating from 35 different databases in 16 countries around the world. This classification system applies to carcinomas of the lung, including non-small cell and small cell carcinomas, and bronchopulmonary carcinoid tumors. It does not apply to sarcomas or other rare tumors of the lung. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with metastasis in contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular lymph node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with metastasis in contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular lymph node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and/or ipsilateral hilar lymph nodes and intrapulmonary nodes, including involvement by direct extension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and/or ipsilateral hilar lymph nodes and intrapulmonary nodes, including involvement by direct extension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with metastasis in ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal lymph node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with metastasis in ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal lymph node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer without regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer without regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Lung Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Lung Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

This classification system derives from analyses of the new retrospective and prospective databases of the International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer (IASLC). These databases contain information on patients diagnosed with lung cancer from 1999 to 2010 originating from 35 different databases in 16 countries around the world. This classification system applies to carcinomas of the lung, including non-small cell and small cell carcinomas, and bronchopulmonary carcinoid tumors.
